user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_allocate:
```c
int metal_softirq_allocate(int num)
{
	int irq_base;

	if ((metal_softirq_avail + num) >= metal_softirq_num) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "No more available soft irqs\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	irq_base = metal_softirq_avail;
	irq_base += metal_softirq_cntr.irq_base;
	metal_softirq_avail += num;
	return irq_base;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_softirq_allocate:
static int metal_softirq_avail
...

...
static METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE(metal_softirq_cntr,
				    METAL_IRQ_ANY, METAL_SOFTIRQ_NUM,
				    NULL,
				    metal_softirq_set_enable, NULL,
				    metal_softirqs)
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided function metal_softirq_allocate and the related code snippets (metal_softirq_avail, METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE usage, and the metal_log macro). There are no calls to memcmp in the displayed code fragments, nor any visible string comparisons that use memcmp. The metal_log macro uses metal_fmt(fmt) but no memcmp is invoked in the macro body shown. Therefore there are no occurrences in the provided code that would trigger investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (the prohibition on using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings). If there are other files or macro/function definitions (e.g., metal_fmt or other omitted expansions) that were not provided, those should be searched for memcmp usages; based on the code you supplied, however, no suspicious fragments exist.
